about_the_game:
Navigate Through the Storm

Not every train that sets out on the Widow's Run is fortunate enough to return. Few conductors have braved this cold expanse and survived, fewer still have braved it and kept their wits intact to tell the tale. Desperate accounts told by men driven to the edge; stories of madness, storms, deadly cold… and strange creatures lurking in the darkness. Fight your way to escape the rails and outrun the storm in this single-player, survival horror game.

Test Your Skills

As the sole engineer on this journey, you must maintain your locomotive's heat, steam, and speed levels to progress. Be careful, as too much, or too little, of any of these resources could end in disaster. 

Fend off the Horrors

As if managing an operational locomotive wasn’t difficult enough, you will also have to contend with the creatures haunting Widow’s Run. These creatures are rumored to be attracted to heat and movement, making you and your locomotive a prime target among the icy wastes of the mountain pass. 

And Survive

Only through careful balance will you be able to pilot and defend your train on the treacherous path through Widow's Run. So with your only way out being forward, will you be able to make it to the end?

Key Features

• Manage the Heat, Steam, and Speed of Your Train - Each dial is a careful balancing act to keep your train moving.

• Defend Yourself - Armed only with a double-barrel shotgun and the sound of the train’s whistle, you must fight off the various creatures who will stop at nothing to end your journey.

• Explore the Mysteries of Widow's Run and Discover its Secrets - Not everything is as it seems. Will you be able to discover the hidden secrets of the mountain pass?

• Short Horror Narrative - Approximately 40 minutes of Playtime.

short_description: It's difficult to know how many locomotives have been swallowed by the suffocating blizzards of the Widow's Run. Cursed with creeping tales of things that lurk in the dark and overshadowed by frequent casualties, it now stands as your only path forward. Will you be able to survive?
